results.headline: Bank of Russia Governor Nabiullina Tells Putin What He Doesn't Want to Hear
results.summary: Bank of Russia Governor Elvira Nabiullina is helping keep Russia’s war economy on the rails but increasingly finds herself out-of-step with the government over key policies.

results.headline: India’s Political Reset Won't Kill Growth
results.summary: Coalition governments were the norm for 25 years before Narendra Modi’s arrival. Investors need to get used to them again.

results.authors: By Macarena Munoz Montijano and Thomas Gualtieri
results.headline: Spain’s PM Sanchez: What Are the Allegations Against His Wife?
results.summary: The increasingly toxic atmosphere in Spanish politics has reached another level, with a judge summoning the wife of Socialist Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez to testify as the target of a criminal investigation into alleged influence peddling. The case has shaken the country’s politics, with Sanchez even threatening briefly to quit after the investigation began. The probe was sparked by a complaint from a small pressure group known for taking leftist politicians to court. The two main parties have

results.headline: South African Elections: Unions Suggest ANC-DA Government Deal
results.summary: South Africa’s biggest labor union federation is pushing the African National Congress to consider seeking support from the main opposition party to enable it to stay in power after it was stripped of its parliamentary majority, a person familiar with the situation said.

results.headline: NATO to Expand Defense Tech, Intelligence Sharing with Kyiv
results.summary: NATO is planning to expand cooperation with Ukraine on defense technology and share more intelligence about Russia’s electronic warfare capabilities, as some of its members lift constraints on Kyiv’s ability to wage war.

results.headline: Albanian Protests Intensify as Opposition Calls on Rama to Resign
results.summary: Albanian protesters calling for Prime Minister Edi Rama to resign set tires ablaze and hurled stones at police after an Italian investigative report raised allegations about the premier’s involvement in organized crime and corruption.

results.authors: By Charlie Zhu and Amanda Wang
results.headline: China Pledges Key Reforms to Revamp Nation’s Medical System
results.summary: China’s cabinet announced Thursday a plan to revamp the nation’s medical system, pledging reforms in areas from public hospitals to insurance payments.

results.headline: America’s Partners in Indo-Pacific Region Sign Economic Pact
results.summary: The US and 13 other nations in Asia and the Pacific signed agreements on an economic pact key to Washington’s strategy to build clout in the region.

results.authors: By Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen and Karthikeyan Sundaram
results.headline: Vietnam Appoints New Enforcer of Its Anti-Corruption Campaign
results.summary: Vietnam’s parliament has tapped a new enforcer of its “blazing furnace” campaign against graft — promoting the current deputy of the public security ministry to become its head.

results.headline: South Africa’s Zizi Kodwa Resigns as Minister After Charges
results.summary: South Africa’s Zizi Kodwa has resigned as minister of sports, arts and culture after appearing a Johannesburg court on corruption charges on Wednesday.
